Why should we follow 'The Data Science Process'?

The data science process helps us systematically turn data into information, gain meaningful insights, and deploy useful models.

#ExploreDataScience #DataAnalytics #DataScience #DataEngineering #UpSkill #Elearning #4IR https://t.co/IicBBXzMPy

The first step in the data science process is finding suitable data sources. Depending on the project, this may be survey data, database or API queried data or existing open data sources.

Open data sources: https://t.co/wu4reQwn8j

#ExploreDataScience #DataAnalytics #DataScience https://t.co/pro7p2CJyB

One of the most time-consuming steps in the data science process is data cleaning. Most of us can agree that insights and analysis are only as good as the data it's based on.

#ExploreDataScience #Data #DataAnalytics #DataScience #DataEngineering #UpSkill #Elearning #4IR https://t.co/KUctJAZn5o

Exploratory Data Analysis (EDA) is the next step after collecting and cleaning the data. This step helps us to understand our data using graphical and non-graphical analysis.  What is the difference? Our next post will show you. 

#ExploreDataScience #DataAnalytics #DataScience https://t.co/VtE2BZtyQ5

Univariate analysis is the exploration of individual variables or features in a data set, i.e., we only consider one variable at a time. 

Stay tuned for the explanation of multivariate analysis. 

#ExploreDataScience #DataAnalytics #DataScience #Data #Insights #TechSkills #4IR https://t.co/xvDQzFCCLj

With multivariate analysis, we explore the relationship between different variables or features of our data set.

#ExploreDataScience #DataAnalytics #DataScience #Data #Insights #TechSkills #UpSkill #Elearning #4IR https://t.co/RqUG70A8zg
